main event: A circular UFO with light beams radiating from it was sighted hovering low in the sky in Hillcrest Heights, Maryland on 8 September 1954. The speed was estimated to be less than 5 m.p.h., and it disappeared from view after a 2-minute observation.
interesting points: The UFO was described as circular with light beams or rays radiating from it, appearing much like a star.
The size of the UFO was compared to an aircraft recognition light at 2222 feet.
The observer, a Major with 15 years of piloting experience, was certain that the UFO could not have been an aircraft.
The weather at the time of observation was CAVU (Ceiling And Visibility Unlimited).
The observation took place between Bolling and Andrews Air Force Bases.
witnesses: Major with 15 years of piloting experience
